Class MockBackgroundTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.grakn.engine.tasks.mock.MockBackgroundTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BackgroundTask
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EndlessExecutionMockTask, FailingMockTask, LongExecutionMockTask, ShortExecutionMockTask

    public abstract class MockBackgroundTask
extends Object
implements BackgroundTask
    Main task Mock class- keeps track of completed and failed tasks

    alexandraorth, Felix Chapman

      • start

        public final boolean start(Consumer<TaskCheckpoint> saveCheckpoint,
                           mjson.Json configuration)
        Description copied from interface: BackgroundTask
        Called to start execution of the task, may be called on a newly scheduled or previously stopped task.
        Specified by:
        start in interface BackgroundTask
        Parameters:
        saveCheckpoint - Consumer which can be called at any time to save a state checkpoint that would allow the task to resume from this point should it crash.
        Returns:
        true if the task successfully completed, or false if it was stopped.

      • stop

        public final boolean stop()
        Description copied from interface: BackgroundTask
        Called to stop execution of the task, may be called on a running or paused task. Task should stop gracefully.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface BackgroundTask
        Returns:
        true if the task was successfully stopped, or false if it could not be stopped. TODO: Should we allow start() to be called after stop()?

      • resume

        public final boolean resume(Consumer<TaskCheckpoint> saveCheckpoint,
                            TaskCheckpoint lastCheckpoint)
        Description copied from interface: BackgroundTask
        This method may be called when resuming from a paused state or recovering from a crash or failure of any kind.
        Specified by:
        resume in interface BackgroundTask
        Parameters:
        saveCheckpoint - Consumer which can be called at any time to save a state checkpoint that would allow the task to resume from this point should it crash.
        lastCheckpoint - The last checkpoint as sent to saveCheckpoint.
